editorial_summary.overview: Mixed facility with 3 pools, a sauna and steam room, gym and studio with fitness classes.

reviews.text:
I'm giving the place 2 stars purely because of my class instructor, who was very engaging and motivating. However this Better centre is absolutely shocking and definitely the worst I've encountered in terms of facilities and hygiene standards.

Firstly: fitness classes. I have never been to another Better gym - or gym full-stop - that doesn't host classes in a studio space. This place hosts certain classes in a massive sports hall, which is split in half. The other half of the space is used to run kids' activities. As you can imagine, it's hard to stay focused on your class when there are kids screaming in the background. It's also very uncomfortable and awkward doing classes in there as the floor above (including the cafe) overlooks the gym, which means there are always people gawping at class-goers as if it's a human zoo. Really not great for self-conscious exercisers. It's really not an appropriate space for intensive classes, and I'm shocked that a centre so huge hasn't built in proper studios.

My other huge gripe is the appalling changing room facilities for the sports hall. They sit in a miserable airless and dimly lit basement space. There are NO private showers. The only option is a cluster of prison-style showers, which have a tiny dribble of water coming out of them. I don't know about you, but I'm not at all comfortable showering naked in front of a load of strangers. I can't believe this exists in this day and age! It also reeked of poo, coming from ONE solitary toilet cubicle nearby. There's also only one hairdryer in these changing rooms, which isn't great.

The lockers are another let-down. There's no consistency between Better gyms and how their lockers work. I've been to one that only accepts token payments, while several others accept pound coins. But this branch only accepts 20p coins. I felt like I'd been thrust back to the early 90s.

Have only used the swimming pool here and it's pretty good, does the job. The changing rooms can be quite dirty though, hair all over the showers. Some of the lockers don't work properly - you put money in and it gets stuck. Avoid the gym at kids swim lesson time though, it's too crazy.

Lovely building and friendly staff, the opening hours are long and there are lots of great facilities. My only frustration is that yoga and pilates classes get booked up way ahead of time or are 'unavailable' with no reason given. It seems that these classes are very popular so it would be great if the centre could schedule more of them.

I swim in the main pool 5-6 days a week. The pool has a really comfortable temperature, large showers, everything is convenient. Don't forget the 20p for the locker!
The only bad thing is mold and even green moss around the pool and in the showers. It's not much, but it's there. I understand that mold is everywhere in Britain, but please try to fight it!
The staff is very friendly and polite.
I also went to yoga a couple of times, everything is perfect there, going to go again.

Cancelled my overpriced membership.

No space when you go swimming, filled with people and no enforcement of rules for lane swimming.

Dirty changing room area, and lax attitude to letting men into the women's.

Classes are always booked up.

Classes are frequently cancelled.

No decent air con and classes start min 10 minutes late.

Classes shunt so many people into one small space, it's hard to do the exercises.

The only pro is some of the instructors being great.

address: 63 Clissold Rd, London N16 9EX, United Kingdom
